org.netbeans.a11y
Class AccessibilityTester

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.netbeans.a11y.AccessibilityTester
public class AccessibilityTester
extends java.lang.Object

AccessibilityTester assess the accessibility of GUI components.

To assess a component, testProperties will check the relevant properties of the component used when the AccessibiltyTester was constructed and any children of it (if it is a container).

To test whether components are reachable with the Tab key, testTraversal will try to visit every focus traversable component by simulating Tab keypress events.

System properties used by AccessibiltyTester

  • a11ytest.tab_timeout - timeout (in ms) for cancelling the tab traversal (default = 15000)
  • a11ytest.tab_delay - the delay (in ms) between tab key presses (default = 300)

getModel

public javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode getModel()
Return AWT - tree of tested container. Call addToModel(parent);

Returns:
parent node of AWT tree model of tested container

startTests

public void startTests()

testProperties

public void testProperties()
Assess the accessibility properties of the component.

If the component is null, the method returns. If the component is a container, all of the components in the container are assessed for their accessibility recursively.

testTraversal

public boolean testTraversal()
Use Tab traversal from the specified component to check which components can be reached without the mouse.

A custom focus listener catches the FOCUS_GAINED events and adds the focused component to a list. The test terminates when a component gains the keyboard focus that is already in the list, hence it has already been visited.

This list of components is then removed from the list of traversable components. Any components left in the list at this point are not reachable by Tab traversal.
